result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MAXIMUS A DAVIS

records.addlTxt:
2:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MAXIMUS A DAVIS in court.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for MAXIMUS A DAVIS. 
19CM370, 21CF236, 22CF62
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
21CF236, Count 1, Defendant enters guilty plea. 
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

Court vacates DAGP in Count 1 in 19CM370 and accepts defendant's no contest plea. 

21CF236, Counts 2 and 3 DRI. 21CF639 & 22CF62 DRI. 

Court orders: 

21CF236
Withheld sentence, 48 months probation 
117 days credit if revoked
180 days jail, stayed, to be used at the discretion of the agent 
absolute sobriety, no intox, sale, para, shot, assess, noas-drugs/para
$518, cash bond applied, remaining balance to be refunded
DNA
Apply to drug court, if accepted, make good faith effort to complete. Defendant to stop after hearing to inquire about applying.
Restitution for medical expenses if requested, to be determined by 6/17/2022

19CM370
$589, 60 days to pay
DNA

10:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MAXIMUS A DAVIS not in court.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for MAXIMUS A DAVIS. 
Defendant in custody at Marathon County jail. 
Attorney Harless for today's purposes only. 
If video is necessary for next appearance, State to make arrangements. 
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:25 AM Defendant MAXIMUS A DAVIS in court with Attorney Zebulon Patek.  Scott Zehr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
21CF236, 21CF639, 19CM370, 22CF62
Awaiting discovery.
Complete booking process in 22CF62. 
Court orders defendant to become compliant with pretrial monitoring.
Bond continued.  Review hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
BOND COVERS 21CF236 (modified), 21CF639(amended) & 22CF62 (new).
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia,
Defendant shall not possess any syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs / drug paraphernalia.

10:20 AM Defendant MAXIMUS A DAVIS in court with Attorney Zebulon Patek.  Scott Zehr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
19CM270: Motion to vacate DAGP filed. 
21CF236 & 21CF639: RH
22CF62: INIT
Attorney waives reading of complaint. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint.
  Review hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
